report.title: WALK THE TALK-VARDHAMAN 2019

description.text: <p>IEEE Women in Engineering Affinity Group has come up with first edition of their flagship event called &ldquo;WALK THE TALK&rdquo; in association with IEEE Vardhaman Student Branch under IEEE Hyderabad Section with the theme of "<strong>Go Confidently and Live the Life You Have Always Imagined</strong>&rdquo; on 26<sup>th</sup> and 27<sup>th</sup> July 2019. The event had diverse speakers from wide areas like entrepreneurship, advancing technology, safety &amp; security, social reforms, health care and many more. The student coordinators were Mr. M. Sai Prashanth and T. Thanmai. The Event was attended by 350+ students from various reputed institutes across Telangana.&nbsp;The chief guest for the event was Ms. Deepthi Ravula, CEO WE-HUB, Hyderabad.&nbsp; The aim of this event was to bring members from different student branches together to collaborate on new ideas and get awareness about the latest trends and innovations in their Leadership Skills, Women Safety and Security, Health and Career Development. Also to administer the IEEE Student and Research Engineer Program to mentor young girls in junior high schools.</p>

report.keywords: Leadership skills Women safety and security health and career development

topic.title: insight carrier opportunities,Technical Jobs in private and public sector

description.text: <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Technical Education in India is at the crossroads now. We in India have gradually raised our standards in technology-related manufacturing and service sectors. With the recent government initiatives such as &ldquo;Make in India&rdquo;, &ldquo;Digital India&rdquo;, and &ldquo;Start-Up India, Stand-Up India&rdquo;, there is a growing awareness towards more practicable and outcome-based education. The All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) has thus initiated the process of redesigning engineering curriculum to suit the needs of today and tomorrow, bringing in more social consciousness into engineering education through mandatory courses in Environmental Studies, Indian Constitution, and Essence of Indian Traditional Knowledge, apart from courses pertaining to Management and Entrepreneurship. Such paradigm shift is much needed at this juncture when Engineering is no longer about providing basic infrastructure and basic amenities to the Society.</p>

description.text: <p>WIE AG Vardhaman College of Engineering in association with IEEE Hyderabad Section WIE AG&nbsp; is organizing a 2 day program for government school children studying in class 9<sup>th</sup>&nbsp;. Students will be taught the skills to improve their computer literacy, communication and also awareness about cyber crimes</p>

report.title: Inauguration of IEEE WIE chapter at Balaji Institute of Technology & Science,Warangal

description.text: <p>Women have been proven to be more ethical, in research done by Laura Kray and Michael<br />Haselhuhn in 2011&ndash;&rsquo;12 and corroborated by various researchers ever since. Women have been proven to<br />be more efficient managers than men in general. But it is not about what women have proven themselves<br />to be &mdash; we must realise that we must design a world that does not require women, or even men, to<br />prove themselves on basis on gender! Understanding and respecting both genders &mdash; their natural<br />limitations and natural advantages; their approaches, strengths and opportunities; their human stories<br />really &mdash; requires trust, empathy, and mutual respect towards autonomy.</p>

report.title: 1st All Hyderabad Section Women in Engineering Section Student Congress(AHWIESC)

description.text: <p>&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;&nbsp; All Hyderabad Section Women in Engineering Section Student Congress, a massive three day event which is first of its kind in the history of IEEE&nbsp; &nbsp;Hyderabad Section.It was an amalgamation of both technical and&nbsp; networking and was held at Geethanjali College of Engineering and&nbsp; &nbsp; Technology, Hyderabad with the theme "Innovate for Change".The Congress&nbsp; aimed to drive the future women technocrats to ponder over solutions to&nbsp; eradicate the technological challenges that are being faced by community at&nbsp; large.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; With an inspiring theme, the congress brought in 150+ Delegates from&nbsp; &nbsp;around 20 colleges across India to witness the hard work of 52 Volunteers&nbsp; &nbsp;supported by a dynamic team of 30 Ambassadors.The Congress ​commenced&nbsp; with the Lamp Lighting ceremony presided over by the Chief Guest&nbsp; Mrs.Sumathi IPS (DIG - Women Safety TS Police) and other dignitaries. Susan&nbsp; &nbsp;Kathy Land , IEEE President-Elect delivered the keynote address through a&nbsp; recorded video and emphasised on the need of being technologically&nbsp; &nbsp;uptodate. ​A special session on Surviving and Thriving in the age of rapid&nbsp; technology change was delivered by Mr. MGBL Narayana.Mr Ali Mustafa&nbsp; &nbsp;delivered a talk about IEEE Collabratec and its benefits. Mr Akella&nbsp; Raghavendra gave insights into Life is a Google Map! which was thought&nbsp; &nbsp;provoking. Mr. Lakshmi Narayana - Vice Chair Section Hyderabad delivered a&nbsp; talk on Gender Sensitivity, Inclusive and Acquiescence Actions in India which&nbsp; provided an in depth analysis of these issues in India Context. Dr. Varsha&nbsp; Mamidi delivered a session on Technology and Academia.Two hands-on&nbsp; parallel workshops on Machine Learning and the Internet of Things were&nbsp; organised as a part of the congress on the first day. Machine Learning was&nbsp; handled by Ali Mustafa with insights on the depth of ML research approaches&nbsp; and Internet of Things by Ms. Jyothirmaye and Mr. Sandeep with some Real time industry examples.&nbsp; &nbsp; The Second day of the congress commences with the keynote session by&nbsp; &nbsp;Mira Vempati who delivered a talk on Leadership in Industry.The next talk&nbsp; was on Self Defence by Mr. Santosh, founder of Rakshaa . Two hands-on parallel sessions on Teacher In Service Program and Quantum Dot based Circuit Design were organised.TISP track was handled by A. Aravindhan&nbsp; (Chair - IEEE Madras YP) via video conference, further the hands-on teaching tips and making of lesson plan was handled by Saiteja Goud K.</p> <p>The Quantum Dot based circuit design was handled by Mr. Sourav. The workshops were&nbsp; interactive and all students participated enthusiastically. The session was&nbsp; &nbsp;followed by Md Sharif (Young Professional) who delivered a talk on IEEE and&nbsp; its benefits. Then the congress had a fabulous and exciting, exhilarating cultural night followed by delicious dinner.&nbsp; The third day had started off with the talk by Sravanthi Talluri. She gave a&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;lecture on The Math of Assertive Leadership. Her talk focused on the tools an&nbsp; undergraduate should focus upon. The next session was on Airborne systems&nbsp; design overview by Mrs. Nirmala Satish Kumar, Scientist F (Weapon Systems)&nbsp; ADA, Bangalore. Then there was an interesting session on Electrical Safety in&nbsp; &nbsp;Distribution Systems by Dr. P V Rajagopal, Chair, PES/IAS/PEL/Joint&nbsp; &nbsp;Chapter/IEEE Hyderabad Section/India.Then it was followed by session of Mrs. Gouthami K, Electrical Design Engineer,Colloabero Technologies Pvt Ltd on Implementation of Industry 4.0 to make smart factories. It was followed by a session with John Benedict (Young Professional) on Leadership in Life and IEEE.The Afternoon session began with a panel discussion on Women in Academia with 5 Eminent women leaders leading IEEE WIE AG Hyderabad&nbsp; Section and 5 active IEEE Student Volunteers. The panel discussion was&nbsp; followed by IEEE WIE AG SB Chapter Exhibition which provided a platform for Chapters to project their activities. The congress successfully ended with&nbsp; the valedictory with closing comments of Dr. P V Rajagopal, Chair,&nbsp; PES/IAS/PEL/Joint Chapter/IEEE Hyderabad Section/India,Dr.Y. Padma Sai (WIE AG&nbsp; Chair), Dr G.Srilakshmi (SAC Chair), Section Members,Dr Udaya Kumar(GCET&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Principal). Delegates from various colleges shared their feedback about the&nbsp; congress. They felt very happy to be part of this very first WIE AG Congress of&nbsp; IEEE Hyderabad Section. After the valedictory the dignitaries distributed the&nbsp; &nbsp;certificates to the volunteers and delegates. The congress marked a&nbsp; gathering of all the tech women, entrepreneurs and industry experts, young&nbsp; professionals and students from diverse parts of the country.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />We thank the IEEE Hyderabad Section particularly Mr.Amit Kumar (Section&nbsp; Chair) and Management of GCET for the constant support and&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; encouragement which was crucial for delivering the benefit of congress to&nbsp; the student community . We thank our sponsors ​IEEE Collabratec ​and Smart&nbsp; Bridge for joining us in making this initiative successful.&nbsp; We also acknowledge the constant support from all the Chapter Advisors of&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;IEEE SB GCET.&nbsp;</p>

report.title: International Women’s Day Celebrations 2020
report.keywords: n equal world is an enabled world
report.cosponsor_name: Gokaraju Rangaraju Institute of Engineering and Technology

report.title: International Women’s Day Celebrations

description.text: <p>As right said &ldquo;To tell a woman everything she cannot do is to tell her what she can do&rdquo; and to celebrate the strength of women and their accomplishments, the Women in Engineering AG of Vardhaman College of Engineering in association with IEEE WIE AG Hyderabad Section has organized Women&rsquo;s Day Celebrations with the theme <strong>&ldquo;I&rsquo;m Generation Equality: Realizing Women&rsquo;s Right&rdquo; </strong>on March 10<sup>th</sup> 2020. This event was attended by around 70 in-house lady faculty and 76 girl students from nearby Government High School, Narkhuda, Shamshabad along with their teachers.</p>

report.cosponsor_name: Vardhaman College of Engineering, Block-1, 1009 Seminar Hall

description.text: <p>The year 2020 is a pivotal year for advancing gender equality worldwide. The emerging global consensus is that despite some progress, real change has been agonizingly slow for the majority of&nbsp;women&nbsp;and girls in the world today. Today, not even a single county can claim to have achieved gender equality.&nbsp; Multiple obstacles remain unchanged in law and in culture.&nbsp;Women&nbsp;and girls continue to be undervalued. They work more, earn less, also have fewer choices and experience multiple forms of violence at home and in public spaces.<br /> The year 2020 represents an unmissable opportunity to mobilize global action to achieve gender equality and Human Rights of all girls and&nbsp;women</p>

report.title: International Women's day celebrations

description.text: <p>The women's day celebration was celebrated at CVR College of engineering on March 13th 2020 from 2.00PM to 3.30 PM. The guest of honour was Ms. Sujana Cherabuddi, Honrable Secretary , CVR College of engineering. Two eminent speakers were invited. Er. T. Sirisha , Scientist G, RCI and Ms. Prasanna Reddy, Lawyer graced the occasion and delivered talks in their respective domains. An essay writing competition was conducted prior to this celebrations. The topic of essay writing was "SOCIAL MEDIA- Pros and Cons and its impact on society ". Three winners were selected and they were awarded with prizes during this celebration. There were about 100 lady participants. The event was successfully conducted.</p>

report.keywords: Essay writing SOCIAL MEDIA- Pros and Cons and its impact on society

report.title: Need of the hour- wake up and Find solutions ( Save People and Save Country)

description.text: <p style="font-weight: 400;">Corona is widely spreading in India and other parts of the world. During this time of Lock down , we all need to be united and follow the guidelines given by the government for betterment of our society.&nbsp; The lockdown is demoralizing many and also leading to&nbsp; cyber-crimes.</p> <p style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;Let&rsquo;s all join together and find solutions so as to save our people and save our country. A step towards this is taken by IEEE WIE AG&nbsp; and YP Hyderabad Section to help you utilize the time being at home and join for an expert talk on &ldquo;Need of the hour- wake up and find solutions&rdquo; with the theme of &ldquo;Save people and Save Country&rdquo; by Sri. Rama Mohan Ukkalam, SP Crime Spots, CID, Amaravati on 12<sup>th</sup>&nbsp;April 2020 at 5 pm through online (webex).</p>

report.keywords: Cyber-crimes, Need of the hour- wake up and find solutions”

topic.title: Need of the hour- wake up and Find solutions ( Save People and Save Country)
